content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Regular expression to match markdown code fence blocks.
    re = Regex(r"```julia([^`]*)```")
    # Initialize an empty string to accumulate the extracted julia code.
    accumulated_code = ""
    # Loop through each match in the document.
    for m in eachmatch(re, md)
        # Get the text inside the code fence block.
        fenced_code = m.captures[1]
        # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the fenced code.
        clean_code = strip(fenced_code)
        # Append the clean code to the accumulated string with a newline if needed.
        if !isempty(accumulated_code)
            accumulated_code *= "\n"
        end
        accumulated_code *= clean_code
    end
    return accumulated_code
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a string `md` containing the markdown document with Julia language code blocks and returns a string with all the extracted code blocks joined together without the surrounding ````julia` fences and with each block separated by a newline.
